Manager.description: Occasionally rather than displaying the last viewed lane (usually the timeline) Tweetlanes will display another lane when opened. In my case this is usually the "My Tweets" lane, though this may depend on the order of the lanes and which you have visible. Ideally you should be able to mark a lane as default and have it always open there, or opt to display whichever lane was visible when the app was closed.
Manager.title: Tweetlanes forgets the last viewed lane on opening

Manager.description: A few of the other Twitter clients for Android have larger previews for inline media (spanning the width of the text area), instead of a small thumbnail floated to the right of the text. Should this be considered for TweetLanes too? Reasons: It looks a bit slicker when scanning the timeline, as elements are more aligned. It's easier to see the content of the image in a (slightly) larger preview.
Manager.title: Larger inline media

Manager.description: I think it is necessary to be able to delete own tweets in TweetLanes as it is possible in nearly (?) all other Twitter clients.
Manager.title: Implement deleting a tweet

Manager.description: There seems to be an inconsistency between the notice in LICENSE.md and the Apache License 2.0 ยง 9, which allows commercial use. Is this a hard prohibition against charging for TweetLanes or more of a suggestion? I have no plans to sell TweetLanes, I'm just hoping to see it in F-Droid :)
Manager.title: License clarification

Manager.description: Currently, TweetLanes only loads avatars once and keeps them, independent of the actual current avatar of the user. This should be fixed.
Manager.title: Reload Avatars when they change

Manager.description: When tapping on a tweet, it always reloads the tweet in the next view. This is annoying on cell data, especially when on a bad connection (such as on GRPS-level-speed).
Manager.title: Cache tweets for the detailed view

Manager.title: Fail whale when running the app from a build

Manager.description: Retweet and favorite buttons don't have any effect; "discussion" constantly shows "no content loaded at this time" and refreshing does not help.
Manager.title: features not working on tweet details activity

Manager.description: There are no release notes in Google Play for the latest Tweet Lanes update. Also http://bit.ly/TweetLanesReleaseNotes has no new release notes.
Manager.title: No release notes

Manager.description: I just installed the beta with ADN support announced here: https://twitter.com/chrismlacy/status/309754532064272384 I have added my App.net user account, which went well. When I view my TL when switched into the ADN account, the TL shows my Twitter tweets mixed (chronologically) with the ADN messages. Other lanes like My posts, Interactions and Global feed are pure ADN messages. TL and @mentions are mixed. Is this intended behavior? If so, then there is a niggle: Twitter avatars not loading when switched into the ADN account. Android 4.1.1 (Yakjuxw) on Galaxy Nexus.
Manager.title: ADN timeline showing Tweets and ADN messages

Manager.description: See the screenshot. When you choose the Large font size in the settings, the font size of the user name is also larger and the lower part of the character (most stuff under the baseline) is clipped. This does not happen if you choose any other font size. With any other font size, from Extra small to Extra large, the font size of the user name appears to stay the same. Hence no clipping. Only when you choose the Large font, the user names are also displayed larger and get clipped.
Manager.title: Large font size setting clips user names in TL view

Manager.description: Twidere is published under GPLv3. Use of that code is impossible under an Apache licensed project.
Manager.title: Licence problem

Manager.description: It's fairly easy to get the "Rate Limit Exceeded" message on a Twitter account. Unsure if this is due to API 1.1 changes or the App.net changes (or some combination of the two). Reproduce: Keep scrolling through timeline Switch between Twitter and App.net account
Manager.title: Rate Limit Exceeded easily

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce:- Find tweet with a link to user/hashtag/link. Click link on the tweet Tweet detail is opened (or url if external link) - Unwanted action Press back or close browser and the users profile/hashtag search is opened - this is what should have been shown at 3 Press back again to take you to the tweet list. What should happen: click username/hashtag/link within tweet user profile/search/url opens press back to return to tweet list This may have been caused by this merge as I never noticed this behaviour prior to this:- #9
Manager.title: Tap a link in a tweet - incorrect behaviour

Manager.description: When switching accounts, the last read status is not always remember (or remembered wrong). This often puts you at the top of the timeline when looking at the new account.
Manager.title: Status within lane not remembered

Manager.description: When you use Tweet Lanes for the first time, you can select the App.net as your service, but the tutorial that follows is Twitter specific. The users to follow (@chrismlacy and @tweetlanes) are hard coded to the Twitter IDs, and don't follow on App.net.
Manager.title: Tutorial doesn't mention App.net

Manager.description: This was spun off #34 (and not directly related). If you, ideally on a slow connection, start loading on tweets on account 1 (scroll down until you get "Loading") and then quickly switch to account 2, the statuses from account 1 are loaded into the lane for account 2.
Manager.title: Switching accounts while loading statuses displays previous accounts statuses in new account's lane

Manager.description: When pressing the save image button in the image viewer, 2 copies are saved. One in dcim/camera/ folder and a second in pictures/tweet lanes/
Manager.title: Save image created duplicates

Manager.description: The t.co URL shorter length needs to be increased as currently the hard coded values are shorter than the generated URLs returned by twitter causing the characters left count when composing a tweet to be incorrect and post failure notifications when trying to tweet. Current values should be as detailed via the following api call: https://dev.twitter.com/docs/api/1.1/get/help/configuration A short term fix will be to increase the values in the following file https://github.com/chrislacy/TweetLanes/blob/master/android/libraries/SocialNetLib/src/com/twitter/Validator.java - pull request: #50 Long term is to use the api call and use the values returned by the api. Also, to note, there needs to be an additional value for tweets with media, currently twitter returns URLs with 23 characters which is 1 more than the non-HTTPS URLs and the same as HTTPS URLs.
Manager.title: Twitter URL shorter length

Manager.description: Large speed loss from v0.72. Very sluggish now. @hybotics on both services.
Manager.title: Very slow at loading on both Twitter and App.net.

Manager.description: Currently (App.net) and (Twitter) follow the account name. This causes long account names to cut off (App.net) or (Twitter).

Manager.description: Currently, we fetch 50 statuses at a time. With rate limiting, you can reach your limit pretty fast if you haven't fetched in a while. I've previously set it to 100, but users on slow data connections have to wait twice as long to get data and complained. Proposal: Get a small number, say 25, show those, and while the user is reading those 25 fetch the max (250 or so).
Manager.title: Smarter fetching

Manager.description: The example i have seen is that an instagram link with a capital I will not be regarded as a media link. The string checking for types of link (by definition of using java) is case sensitive. Both sides of the comparison should have their case the same. Also to note, on a lot of these types of links, the case of the "code" needs to remain in tact.
Manager.title: Media links case sensitive

Manager.description: The compose bar changes colour depending on I'd you are composing or not Also dm bar is always the same colour as when composing. I think standardise on the non composing colour (the new one)
Manager.title: Compose bar inconsistent colours

Manager.description: Only RT and favorite info passed back, other bits aren't. For example number of retweets.
Manager.title: Whole tweet not passed back from spotlight

Manager.description: Some users are having issues with javascript not being enabled in the Twitter signup webview. Also, App.net is adding a new feature during signup that needs javascript enabled. ;)
Manager.title: Enable javascript in add account webview

Manager.description: We are kinda all over the place with settings. Below is a quick idea of how to better organize it (also adding some features). Each tab in is on it's own page. Let me know if you need me to better explain,
Manager.title: Better organization in settings menu

Manager.description: A fullstop the @ doesn't show auto complete. Also, I seem to be missing people I follow on my auto complete.
Manager.title: Auto complete bugs

Manager.description: Dashclock support isn't working.
Manager.title: Dashclock not working

Manager.description: Ran a code inspection in Android studio which flagged 4,368 pottential "issues" I've never seen a JetBrains code issue return 0 issues, but some of these could do with a look at. Invalid cast, redundant code etc. I think we can reduce the size of the code base making it easier for newbies to see the wood for the trees and hopefully encourage more people to get involved.
Manager.title: Code Tidy Up

Manager.description: Error when refresh and reload saying something like too many terms in search. Happens a lot, and prob should be fixed before store version.
Manager.title: Repeat refresh error

Manager.description: Reports of issues uploading images. Tried to upload an image with the beta to no success.
Manager.title: Can't upload images

Manager.description: This setting is already available in the system settings. Does it need to be in the application settings? Source: https://twitter.com/MarijnvdWerf/status/354941339869253633
Manager.title: Remove font size setting

Manager.description: It looks like we do an auto expand of the t.co URL. though i had a DM which still shows the t.co url. Can we also auto expand these.
Manager.title: URL Expand

Manager.description: Current version is great. But can we add extra features like if I put @jas @Fammy will show as that's his name. Also, if you put @lanes the tweetlanes user will show. Both these make it easier to reply to users.
Manager.title: Auto complete wildcard

Manager.description: Once an image is attached to a message, there is no way to get rid of it. This would (at one stage) have been done using the clear "X" button that we got rid of a couple of releases ago.
Manager.title: Unattach images

Manager.description: When trying to sign into a twitter account with Two-factor authentication turned on the user will not be signed in and redirected to the mobile site after entering their password. Twitter's temporary passwords don't work to sign in.
Manager.title: Twitter's Two Factor Authentication doesn't work

Manager.description: When unselecting tweets the reply doesnt reset to the what's new.
Manager.title: Reply stuck

Manager.description: When sharing the item being shared is lost.
Manager.title: Share to tweetlanes

Manager.description: When open profile from a link in tweet the @ user doesn't show. When open from profile pic it does.
Manager.title: Reply box on profile

Manager.description: @Fammy profile has a t.co link in the text. not sure what it's meant to say but t.co links look nasty.
Manager.title: Link extract on profile text

Manager.description: Only seems to happen on adn. Guessing it's got something to do with the status ids.
Manager.title: New tweet bar reshow

Manager.description: This didn't show on my device post update.
Manager.title: What's New Dialogue

Manager.description: One of our users needs a larger font than that provided in the app.
Manager.title: Need larger font

Manager.description: The top bar looks a little cluttered for users with one or two accounts. We should only show the profile picture and service icon when there are 3 or more accounts added. If this doesn't get changed until the ui overhaul maybe it can also be in a display settings or advanced settings. (Emails with Chris Lacy)
Manager.title: Only show profile picture and service icon when...

Manager.description: Is there a way we can add Google analytics or something of the sort to see user data like location, version, and what they use?
Manager.title: Google Analytics

Manager.description: So I am all way to the top of my timeline and an hour later no new tweets or notifications appear until I pull to refresh. I am using 1.2.0 and have my timeline set to refresh every 30 mins.
Manager.title: Timeline auto refresh not working

Manager.description: It looks like TweetLanes is expanding the t.co links, but then it cuts it short at some hardcoded length? and adds "..." to the end. Would be nice to see the full URL though.
Manager.title: Show full URL in the tweet

Manager.description: Would be nice to see some sort of visual after pressing the favorite (star) icon. Right now it can take several seconds for a tweet to become "favorite". Currently i look to see if there's any network activity to see if it's "working"
Manager.title: Show some sort of interaction/animation/feedback when favoriting a tweet

Manager.description: So I can see image preview in the timeline, however when I press/click on it, it tries to load it (again?) on separate screen but fails. I guess the image is not cached. Also there is no way to refresh or try again.
Manager.title: Clicking on the preview image shows an error

Manager.description: Auto link now puts http at start of link. If I put the text app.net Twitter make this a t.co. When it's displayed, it gets http:// put on front. Not sure if we can stop it, but makes some text look funny. In particular when talking about something .net. I.e app.net, asp.net, vb.net.
Manager.title: Http added to links

Manager.description: I thought I had fixed this one, but looks like it's back. Repo steps: Open a profile Leave profile by back button, or in app back Go into compose window Usename already populated.
Manager.title: Username in compose after viewing profile

Manager.description: So I can reproduce this consistently. If i have "screen rotation" enabled while viewing my timeline if I change the phone orientation the "notification bar" shows up.

Manager.description: It appears that discussions are not showing and haven't been for the last few releases. If I click on a tweet and click on discussion, there is only the ~, even if I refresh it. If I go to the native client they are there.
Manager.title: Discussions not showing

Manager.description: At the moment auto complete only kicks in if you were typing at the end of the status. Not sure if it's possible. But adding the logic to work wherever in the status you are would be great.
Manager.title: Auto complete mid status

Manager.description: #42 does URL handing for status updates. Add support for profiles.
Manager.title: URL handling for profiles

Manager.description: The link on profile is a t.co Needs to be expanded. Should be an easy fix.
Manager.title: Link on Profile

Manager.description: Tweetlanes seems to be able to forget the list position. You have lots of lanes set up a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i (d to i could be lists, but this can also be reproduced on timeline and mentions etc). Open app refresh an active lane (i.e. lane g) with a few (i.e. 15) new tweets. Scroll to top of lane (i.e. lane g). Swipe two (or more) lanes left (i.e. to lane e) or right (i.e. to lane i) Swipe back to lane g position is back to what it was before reloading lane at 1. You can make it remember position by swiping 1 left or right then back to lane or not fully scrolling to the top (although this can be temperamental and cause other lanes to jump to top, however this specific jump may be unrelated as i haven't been able to reproduce on the build BlythMeister supplied today). You can also open tweet detail and go back to lane, or exit app and reopen and it will remember the last position. If you need some lists to subscribe to for checking with multiple lanes, there are a few busy ones here:- https://twitter.com/London2012/lists/olympians https://twitter.com/NASA/lists/astronauts There are plenty of others, or make your own - tweetlanes is awesome with lots of lists ;)
Manager.title: Forgetting lane position

Manager.description: Add a option to have absolute time in the lanes vs relative time.
Manager.title: Absolute time in the lanes

Manager.description: The new theme seems to not load the conversation icon until you click on it. See below... Middle one is the one missing the arrow, left shows it after it's been clicked on and right shows that the icon is fine on dark theme - also fine on light theme.
Manager.title: Holo Light w/Dark action bar missing conversation icon

Manager.description: I've seen this one a few times over the last couple of days. I would click on a tweet and let TweetLanes sit there for hours at a time (running around). When i come back and click "back" here is what happens: I see about 3-4 tweets in the timeline with "Loading..." on the bottom? of the screen. TweetLanes tries to load more tweets to show on the screen (older than the ones on the screen), I guess that would explain the "Loading.." box on the bottom of the screen. It starts loading the previous tweets (newer than the ones on the screen) all over again from the beginning (at times that number goes up to >500 tweets, yes I get it to backup quite a bit on some days). Also it looks like TweetLanes doesn't auto-purge old items as I keep reading and moving up the timeline...
Manager.title: Tweet cache issue/bug?

Manager.description: When you try and unretweet you get a toast (which is correct). But the icon goes to the pressed version. Then changes to not retweeted. When you press again, it gives option to retweet which causes a fatal crash. Once retweeted button should just show toast. This happened in the tweet spotlight.
Manager.title: Un-retweet icon

Manager.description: I followed this https://github.com/chrislacy/TweetLanes/wiki/Building-your-own-an-*.apk instructions for creating a twitter application Discovered then, that the keys need to be written down not in android/client/src/com/tweetlanes/android/Constant.java, but android/client/src/com/tweetlanes/android/ConsumerKeyConstants.java and i corrected wiki. Build apk and installed on the smartphone . But by clicking on the Twitter login form does not appear, and the only white screen. What am I doing wrong? p.s. I using develop branch.
Manager.title: Problem adding Twitter account

Manager.description: Would love the ability to see all mentions (so also from people you don't follow) in the timeline. Maybe have extended options to select what you do and don't want to see in the timeline. So be able to tell TweetLanes to show the following tweet types inside the main Timeline: Mentions (from people you follow) Mentions (from everyone) Direct Messages My tweets Retweets of me Retweets of people I follow (switching that off would prevent your timeline being filled with retweets of a tweet you already have in your timeline)

Manager.title: Auto complete mid status error

Manager.description: When refreshing in landscape with camera on the right, the screen rotates a full 180, then back again. Would guess the lock rotate is having strange effects.
Manager.title: Refresh Screen Rotate

Manager.description: 1.3.0 added a reduced cache to prevent out of memory errors. This is causing some users annoyance. Add config to enable a user to overide the tweetlanes recommend cache size.
Manager.title: Cache size config

Manager.description: With a previous release I added recusion to get all new statuses. However, if everytime Twitter is called an extra 1 status is found, you could end up in a nasty loop. I've seen situations where refresh takes ages, this could be an explanation.
Manager.title: Potential infinite refresh recusion

Manager.description: When I can't read my stream during day, for example, I get a lot of tweets and I want skip their reading
Manager.title: Ability to mark old tweets as read

Manager.description: When I expand some discussion whith several replys, I see that it duplicates in another thread which I don't expand
Manager.title: Comment appearing under wrong conversation

Manager.description: I'm struggling to get my Twitter account working in TweetLanes. I can enter my credentials but the screen that then follows is this one: I've generated a temporary password for now.
Manager.title: Incompatible with Twitter 2-factor

Manager.description: In the official Android Twitter app, one can enable "Login Verification", which makes the app pop up a notification you must respond to to approve any new logins. But when I tap the notification โ switching from Tweet Lanes to Twitter โ Tweet Lanes seems to lose its mind and go back to the front screen, offering me the choice of Twitter and App.net.
Manager.title: can't authorise Tweet Lanes if Login Verification is enabled

Manager.description: Hi! This is my first post here, so I hope I didn't miss anything. Using Android 4.2 and Tweet Lanes 1.3.0 When sharing a post from App.Net and selecting "Link to Tweet", it shares a wrong URL: https://twitter.com/username/status/12345678 Instead of this URL from App.Net: https://alpha.app.net/username/post/12345678 Besides, "Link to Tweet" could also be changed to "Link to Post" to match ADN's terminology. Thanks!
Manager.title: Sharing a post from App.Net provides a Twitter URL instead

Manager.description: Add option to copy status text to clipboard.
Manager.title: Copy status text

Manager.description: When favorite a status icon shows but not sent to Twitter.
Manager.title: Favorites Don't Work

Manager.description: Twitter4J supports gzip compression on request response. We don't seem to set this to true, so may relate to why get status seems slow. If not that, then the request processing may have something slowing process down?!
Manager.title: Intergration Slow With Twitter

Manager.description: Unable to login with twitter on android 4.4.4 and L
Manager.title: Unable to login

Manager.description: Hello! I'm currently trying to build Tweet Lanes and want to set my own keys. I also could do that, but setting my own keys did that my app didn't let me log in anymore. Which settings do I have to set in Twitter developers? Thanks Florent1510
Manager.title: Own keys

Manager.description: They seem to have a new policy dated May 18th 2015 to need to add mobile phone details? I have added mobile phone details and received text message to say my mobile phone is activated, but clicking 'Create New App' button in https://apps.twitter.com/ still says I need to add phone details? EDIT: Using a previously dummy app to put in place Consumer Keys and Secrets, was able to run this app, but upon launching just got a blank screen on the GenyMotion emulator. Does it also require Twitter Login? as emualator doesnt have Twitter App installed? Status Code 401? 401:Authentication credentials (https://dev.twitter.com/pages/auth) were missing or incorrect. Ensure that you have set valid consumer key/secret, access token/secret, and the system clock is in sync. I did add these values, but it is coming from another project, so my question is whether it matters the name of the project in Android Studio, has to be exactly the same as name inside App.net and Twitter as I took those key/secret from those projects, since Twitter cannot Create New Apps at the moment.
Manager.title: Cannot create new app in Twitter
